intro: Lepidaploa glabra, commonly known as the smooth lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Lepidaploa glabra is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
